intro: Gymnogramma procera, commonly known as the tall cliff fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its tall, erect fronds that can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The plant has a creeping rhizome that allows it to spread and colonize rocky or shaded areas. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated margins and a distinctive, often pale underside. Gymnogramma procera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
